nutrition.title: The Truth About Food and Disease Prevention
key_takeaways: Food is medicine - every meal is a chance to heal or harm
Mediterranean diet reduces cancer risk by 15-20%
Small changes sustained over time beat dramatic short-term diets
action_items: Add olive oil to your daily routine
Eat fish twice per week
Include nuts as snacks

nutrition.title: How Not to Die: Preventing Disease with Food
key_takeaways: Plant foods contain natural compounds that fight cancer
Berries are particularly powerful against breast cancer cells
Cruciferous vegetables boost your body's detox systems
action_items: Eat a handful of berries daily
Include broccoli or cauliflower 3x per week
Try green tea instead of coffee

exercise.title: Exercise as Medicine: Cancer Prevention Through Movement
key_takeaways: 150 minutes per week reduces breast cancer risk by 25%
Exercise improves immune function
Even walking counts as protective exercise
action_items: Start with 20-minute walks 3x per week
Take stairs instead of elevators
Park further away to add steps

exercise.title: The Brain-Changing Benefits of Exercise
key_takeaways: Exercise immediately improves mood and reduces anxiety
Physical activity strengthens the mind-body connection
You don't need intense workouts to see benefits
action_items: Try 10 minutes of morning movement
Dance to 3 songs while cooking
Do bodyweight exercises during TV commercials

stress_management.title: How Meditation Changes Your Brain and Body
key_takeaways: 8 weeks of meditation physically changes brain structure
Reduces inflammation throughout the body
Just 5 minutes daily provides measurable benefits
action_items: Try 5 minutes of guided breathing daily
Use a meditation app for consistency
Practice mindful eating at one meal per day

stress_management.title: Breathing Techniques for Instant Calm
key_takeaways: Proper breathing activates the relaxation response
4-7-8 breathing technique reduces anxiety in minutes
Breathing exercises work anywhere, anytime
action_items: Practice 4-7-8 breathing before bed
Use deep breathing during stressful moments
Set reminders for breathing breaks

medical_experts.title: Taking Charge of Your Breast Health
key_takeaways: Early detection saves lives but prevention is better
Know your personal risk factors
Advocate for yourself in healthcare settings
action_items: Schedule overdue screenings
Learn proper self-exam technique
Discuss family history with your doctor

medical_experts.title: Dense Breasts: What Every Woman Should Know
key_takeaways: 40% of women have dense breast tissue
Dense tissue requires additional screening methods
Ultrasound and MRI can detect cancers mammograms miss
action_items: Ask about breast density at your next mammogram
Discuss additional screening options
Understand your insurance coverage for supplemental screening

sleep_health.title: The Sleep Doctor's Guide to Better Rest
key_takeaways: Quality sleep is when your body repairs DNA damage
Blue light exposure disrupts natural sleep cycles
Consistent sleep schedule is more important than total hours
action_items: Set a consistent bedtime and wake time
Avoid screens 1 hour before bed
Keep bedroom cool and dark

inspiration.title: Finding Humor and Strength After Cancer
key_takeaways: Humor and positivity are powerful healing tools
Taking control of your health journey empowers you
Support systems are crucial for success
action_items: Find one thing to laugh about each day
Connect with supportive friends or family
Celebrate small health victories
